content: I can confirm it's unavailable in 115, present in 102. I don't know if this is deliberate or a bug, but I suggest you report it at Bugzilla, including a link to this topic, and posting a link to the bug here.
creator: sfhowes

content: P.S. I've also rebooted Thunderbird a few times and my computer once. I'm on Win10.
creator: DorothyJ

content:
This was starting to happen regularly today. On Friday, when I made the upgrade, everything seemed fine. It also seemed fine on Saturday except for a very few exceptions. Today, I get the delayed headers regularly. While they usually do update if I wait long enough, this is really impacting my productivity. So I just went back to 102.15.1 using a copy of my profile that I saved right before I made the upgrade and a saved version of the earlier code. Perhaps there is some kind of issue with scratch space cleanup or something like that which causes this issue to get worse over time. I will wait for a newer version of 115 before I try the upgrade again.

I think it is great the TB team is making the effort to upgrade the code base and set the program up for the future. I guess it is just a bit more complicated than people thought.

By the way, I did have to upgrade two of my plugins, xpunge and Cardbook, when I made the 115 upgrade. TB did not warn me that either was incompatible, but I checked them to be sure when I did the prior upgrade. Perhaps you need to spread the word more widely to check for new plugins when upgrading.
creator: marklang

content: Here is an update. I have begun to notice this issue happening a lot more often. However, it seems to correct. That is, I will go to a new message. The message body appears almost immediately. However, the header is left over from the last email. However, usually, if I stay on that message long enough, the header will update to that of the current email. It is taking 15 seconds or more on some emails. Some update within a second. That really gets in the way of scanning through a large number of emails. I did repair the folder, but it did not help. The folder is pretty large, over 2.5GB. However, that has not caused any issues for many many years.
creator: marklang

content:
Per intervenire su un singolo aspetto come l'interlinea del pannello cartelle, si dovrebbe probabilmente agire sul file userChrome.css. Tuttavia questo genere di modifica è generalmente sconsigliata -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/userChromecss-userChromejs-userContentcss-non-supportati

Il pulsante Densità a cui accenni agisce su tutta l'interfaccia grafica. In maniera simile si comporta il paramento layout.css.devPixelsPerPx (il cui funzionamento a grandi linee è spiegato qui -> https://radiofaro.neocities.org/kb/index/006)

creator: wsmwk

content:
Is the folder pane and the message list pane are blank? Then the pane system did not initialize. We find so far that users have a folder that causing the problem, and the name of the folder will likely be shown in the error console. Check tools > developer > error console for errors (not warnings) about folders or panes. Please post what you find.

If only unified folders is the problem then

  1. open the troubleshooting information on the help menu.
  2. Click the show profile button
  3. Close Thunderbird
  4. Open the "mail" folder in the file manager window that opened.
  5. Delete the folder named "smart mailboxes"
  6. Restart Thunderbird.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Instead of applying Unified view, you might get better results by creating Saved Searches (File/New/Saved Search...). Unified is just a type of saved search.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Saved_Search

content:
You can try the standard steps to repair Unified View: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete virtualFolders.dat and the Mail/smart mailboxes subfolder. Restart TB and select Unified Folders view.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Unified_Folders_not_working
creator: sfhowes

content: That sounded promising, but in fact All Folders wasn't checked. I tried several rounds of checking/rechecking/restarting in the hopes it would all reset, but that didn't work. I should be clear (see image) that this is not a separate window in the folders pane (like All Folders), but duplication within the Unified Folders view.
creator: bma.query

content: When you select View/Folders/Unified Folders, All Folders is already checked, so select View/Folders again and uncheck All Folders.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The picture in my reply appears after you select Print... from the menu.

You can always select the desired portion, then copy it (Ctrl+C) and paste into Notepad (Ctrl+V), and print from Notepad.
